page.title: 03ROTHERHAM HEADLINES
page.content: { Rotherham headlines May 1985. "Devastating effects of the Decline revealed". A recent survey undertaken by the coalfield communities campaign, shows the effects of industrial decline. Unemployment runs at 21% and the town is one of the worst hit areas in the country with little prospect of improvement. The knock on effects are reflected in the numerous calls for social service help. Since 1980, free school meals have doubled to 9,810, clothing grants 190 to 6628 and maintenance awards have trebled from 54 to 154. the social services department has 34% increase in cases and dealt with 15,000 referrals last year. There are housing difficulties and rent arrears went up to 35% from 25% with 19,582 people claiming rent rebates this year.
